alert.note: Alert for Bollinger; Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 5:15AM CDT until August 14 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR BOLLINGER AND NORTHERN WAYNE COUNTIES... At 515 AM CDT, Local law enforcement and emergency management officials indicated that while the heaviest rain has come to an end, very heavy rain from overnight thunderstorms has resulted in substantial flash flooding across Bollinger and northern Wayne counties. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain has fallen in a band from Coldwater to Cascade to Grassy to Glenallen to Marble Hill. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Piedmont, Marble Hill, Sam A. Baker State Park, Cascade, Grassy, Lodi, Leopold, Zalma and Glenallen. High water rescues are currently underway in the community of Glenallen and at a campground near the Castor River at 34 and Y Highway. High water has also closed the bridge into Marble Hill. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
